answers.answer: A csection isnt that bad. I had one with my son. I was up walking that afternoon. I thought it would be awful but it wasnt. The dr glued the incision shut and put the butterfly tape over it, so no staples. The worst part was my arm where my iv blew. I could barely move my arm. I think i will do a csection this time too. Hadnt thought about it until now.

This same thing happened (is happening to me) scheduled section next Wed due to breech baby. However I had an ultrasound at the high risk unit yesterday and she is now head down so she flipped since last Thursday. I'm 38w 4 days currently and am so confused as I was all set mentally for my scheduled section. I see my OB tomorrow and she will probably cancel it now that baby is head down. My hubby is outraged as he liked knowing the schedule for delivery.

I had a horrible c section experience! Im going for vbac this time and pray I wont have to go through it again. I was in the hospital for 4 days, first 36hrs I was stuck in bed (between post op recovery not going smoothly and them keeping me on bed rest longer than normal). I dont even hardly remember being able to see nor hold my son during the first 18hrs after birth.Recovery after the hospital stay was easy and not that bad. I had staples removed after 10 days. I stopped bleeding just over 2wks post partum. I never felt painful enough to have to take the meds they sent me home with, tylenol was sufficient on occassion. I was back riding horses by almost 4wks post partum.

I just had my csection yesterday I been up n walking around its not always bad I feel ok just a little sore u will be ok just make sure you have help and get plenty of rest afterwards I wish you the best  and just remember ull have your baby soon enough :-) if u have any more questions just ask

question: So I found out today at my 35 week appointment that my baby is breech and his bottom is wedged down in my cervix, my doctor said they would be doing a csection in 2 weeks (37 weeks, I also have gestational diabetes and they believe im developing preeclampsia)  can someone tell me what to expect ect. Ive always delivered vaginally and im terrified, ive never had any type of surgery or anything else. Help!
title: csection
